thread.title: Dog gives birth to mint chocolate Labrador puppy
thread.title_full: Dog gives birth to mint chocolate Labrador puppy

author: Richard Hartley-Parkinson
title: Dog gives birth to mint chocolate Labrador puppy
text:
Richard Hartley-Parkinson for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 7 Feb 2017 7:18 am It ain’t easy being green (Picture: Ross Parry) 
A dog owner got the shock of her life when her chocolate Labrador gave birth to a green puppy. 
Two-year-old mother Milly had four male puppies and one girl during her first litter on January 26. Mother can't help speaking in different accents after suffering weird migraines 
But gender wasn’t the only difference that marked the female puppy from her brothers because she emerged not golden like the others – but green. 
The green tinge is down to over exposure to a substance called biliverdin, which can be found in the placenta. 
It’s a rare condition and owner Elaine Cooper believes their pup – could be just the third case in the world. (Picture: Ross Parry) (Picture: Ross Parry) 
Elaine and husband Mark have now nicknamed the pup Fifi after the famous green ogre Princess Fiona from Shrek. 
Elaine, of Chorley, Lancs., said: ‘She came out in the sack so we thought that it was the placenta that made her look very dark. We thought she was a black Labrador. Man's ingrown hair turned into a 9kg tumour 
‘But when Milly started to lick the placenta off she actually had a green tinge. We were laughing and saying no, this can’t be green. 
‘All the others are golden and this one’s green. It’s to do with the placenta, so it’s a phenomenon, it’s just very rare in dogs. (Picture: Ross Parry) (Picture: Ross Parry) 
‘We were a bit shocked, then laughed and thought, ‘Oh my, is it ok’.’ 
Elaine, 56, and 46-year-old Mark are planning to sell the puppies once they’re old enough. Giant 'sea beast' photobombs a couple's romantic snap 
She added: ‘The colour’s faded now and she’s doing well even though she was the smallest of the litter, she’s so sweet.’ 
Elaine, who owns a motorhome business, has researched the condition online and has found just two other cases of Labradors born green – on in Spain and the other Clayton-le-Moors, Lancs., in 2012. 
While it stains, Fifi’s green tinge is only temporary and she will soon resemble her boisterous brothers. (Picture: Ross Parry)
